intro: Senecio conradii, commonly known as the Conradi's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellow, forming dense clusters. Senecio conradii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its compact growth habit and attractive foliage.
